note.p: Death: His house, James Street, Buckingham Gate, London (31 May 1825)
Education: Fochabers; King's College, Aberdeen; Edinburgh (law)

Career: Went to Maryland with his uncle and practised as a lawyer in Baltimore (age 21); returned to Great Britain at the outbreak of war; wrote biographies of Defoe and Thomas Paine; published "Caledonia : an account ... of North Britain" (1807-1824)
